com.deltaxml.cores9api

Class FilterStepHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.deltaxml.cores9api.FilterStepHelper

  • public class FilterStepHelper
extends java.lang.Object

    Provides a mechanism for creating FilterStep instances. A FilterStepHelper stores a Saxon Processor and a URIResolver, both of which are used in the creation of FilterSteps. If you wish to use different instances of these objects for different FilterStep instances, we would recommend creating multiple instances of a FilterStepHelper.

    The simplest, and recommended, way of creating a FilterStepHelper is to call the creation method from PipelinedComparatorS9. This will use the Processor and URIResolver currently in use by the PipelinedComparatorS9 to create FilterStep instances.

    Since:
    7.0
    See Also:
    PipelinedComparatorS9.newFilterStepHelper()

    • Constructor Detail

      • FilterStepHelper

        public FilterStepHelper(Processor p,
                        org.xml.sax.EntityResolver er,
                        javax.xml.transform.URIResolver ur)
                 throws ParserInstantiationException

        Creates a FilterStepHelper using the specified Processor and URIResolver.

        N.B. The recommended way of constructing a FilterStepHelper is to use PipelinedComparatorS9.newFilterStepHelper()

        Parameters:
        p - the Processor to use when creating FilterStep instances
        er - the EntityResolver to use when creating FilterStep instances
        ur - the URIResolver to use when creating FilterStep instances
        Throws:
        ParserInstantiationException - if there is an issue creating a parser for use by the FilterStepHelper

    • Method Detail

      • newFilterChain

        public FilterChain newFilterChain()
        Creates a new, empty FilterChain in which to add FilterSteps.
        Returns:
        an empty FilterChain

      • newFilterChain

        public FilterChain newFilterChain(java.lang.String name)

        Creates a new, empty, named FilterChain in which to add FilterSteps.

        If you intend to use a FilterChain as a FilterStep within another FilterChain, it should be assigned a name. This constructor enables you to set a name for the FilterChain at the same time as creating it.

        Parameters:
        name - the name to assign to the FilterChain
        Returns:
        an empty, named FilterChain

      • newFilterChain

        public FilterChain newFilterChain(java.util.List<FilterStep> filterSteps)
                           throws DuplicateStepNameException,
                                  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Create a new FilterChain which is initially made up of the supplied FilterSteps.

        The FilterSteps will be ordered in the same order that the supplied List defines.

        N.B. If the List is null or empty, an empty FilterChain will be created.

        Parameters:
        filterSteps - a List of FilterSteps that make up the FilterChain
        Returns:
        a FilterChain made up of the supplied FilterSteps
        Throws:
        DuplicateStepNameException - if there is more than one FilterStep with a given name
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the List contains any null entries

      • newSingleStepFilterChain

        public FilterChain newSingleStepFilterChain(java.io.File filter,
                                            java.lang.String filterName)
                                     throws FilterConfigurationException

        Creates a new FilterChain containing a single FilterStep from a File containing an XSLT stylesheet..

        This helper method can be used to quickly populate a FilterChain with a single step. Please note that it is still possible to add more FilterSteps to the chain.

        Parameters:
        filter - an instance of a File to use when creating the FilterStep. This must be an XSLT file.
        filterName - the name to use for the FilterStep
        Returns:
        an unnamed FilterChain containing the single FilterStep
        Throws:
        FilterConfigurationException - if there are problems creating the FilterStep from the XSLT stylesheet. Possible problems include: reading the File, parsing the File, compiling the XSLT.

      • newSingleStepFilterChain

        public FilterChain newSingleStepFilterChain(java.lang.Class<? extends org.xml.sax.helpers.XMLFilterImpl> filter,
                                            java.lang.String filterName)
                                     throws FilterClassInstantiationException

        Creates a new FilterChain containing a single FilterStep from a Class that extends XMLFilterImpl.

        This helper method can be used to quickly populate a FilterChain with a single step. Please note that it is still possible to add more FilterSteps to the chain.

        Parameters:
        filter - an instance of a Class that extends XMLFilterImpl to use when creating the FilterStep
        filterName - the name to use for the FilterStep
        Returns:
        an unnamed FilterChain containing the single FilterStep
        Throws:
        FilterClassInstantiationException - if the supplied Class cannot be instantiated. The underlying cause will give details on the reasons for the Exception
        See Also:
        FilterStepHelper.newFilterChain(), FilterStepHelper.newFilterStep(Class, String)

      • newSingleStepFilterChain

        public FilterChain newSingleStepFilterChain(java.net.URL filter,
                                            java.lang.String filterName)
                                     throws FilterConfigurationException

        Creates a new FilterChain containing a single FilterStep from a URL referencing an XSLT stylesheet.

        This helper method can be used to quickly populate a FilterChain with a single step. Please note that it is still possible to add more FilterSteps to the chain.

        Parameters:
        filter - a URL referencing an XSLT filter to use as the FilterStep
        filterName - tthe name to use for the FilterStep
        Returns:
        an unnamed FilterChain containing the single FilterStep
        Throws:
        FilterConfigurationException - if there are problems creating the FilterStep from the XSLT stylesheet. Possible problems include: connecting to and reading the URL, parsing the contents of the URL, compiling the XSLT.
        See Also:
        FilterStepHelper.newFilterChain(), FilterStepHelper.newFilterStep(URL, String)

      • newSingleStepFilterChain

        public FilterChain newSingleStepFilterChain(org.xml.sax.helpers.XMLFilterImpl filter,
                                            java.lang.String filterName)

        Creates a new FilterChain containing a single FilterStep from an instance of an XMLFilterImpl.

        This helper method can be used to quickly populate a FilterChain with a single step. Please note that it is still possible to add more FilterSteps to the chain.

        Parameters:
        filter - an XMLFilterImpl instance to use as the basis for the FilterStep
        filterName - the name to use for the FilterStep
        Returns:
        an unnamed FilterChain containing the single FilterStep
        See Also:
        FilterStepHelper.newFilterChain(), FilterStepHelper.newFilterStep(XMLFilterImpl, String)

        filter - an XsltExecutable instance to use as the basis for the FilterStep
        filterName - the name to use for the FilterStep
        Returns:

      • newLockedFilterChain

        public FilterChain newLockedFilterChain(java.util.List<FilterStep> filterSteps,
                                        java.lang.String name)
                                 throws DuplicateStepNameException,
                                        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Create a new FilterChain which is made up of the supplied FilterSteps and cannot be subsequently modified. FilterStep parameters can be changed but the FilterSteps that make up the FilterChain cannot be modified.

        The FilterSteps will be ordered in the same order that the supplied List defines.

        N.B. If the List is null or empty, an empty FilterChain will be created.

        Parameters:
        filterSteps - a List of FilterSteps that make up the FilterChain
        name - a name to assign to the FilterChain if it is being added as a FilterStep
        Returns:
        a locked FilterChain made up of the supplied FilterSteps
        Throws:
        DuplicateStepNameException - if there is more than one FilterStep with a given name
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the List contains any null entries

      • newFilterStep

        public FilterStep newFilterStep(java.lang.Class<? extends org.xml.sax.helpers.XMLFilterImpl> filter,
                                java.lang.String name)
                         throws FilterClassInstantiationException

        Creates a new FilterStep Object from a Class that extends XMLFilterImpl.

        Parameters:
        filter - a Class instance that is an extension of XMLFilterImpl
        name - the name to assign to the FilterStep
        Returns:
        a FilterStep containing an instance of the XMLFilterImpl
        Throws:
        FilterClassInstantiationException - if the supplied Class cannot be instantiated. The underlying cause will give details on the reasons for the Exception

      • newFilterStep

        public FilterStep newFilterStep(java.io.File filter,
                                java.lang.String name)
                         throws FilterConfigurationException

        Creates a new FilterStep Object from a File containing an XSLT stylesheet.

        Parameters:
        filter - a File Object representing an XSLT stylesheet
        name - the name to assign to the FilterStep
        Returns:
        a FilterStep containing a runnable version of the XSLT stylesheet
        Throws:
        FilterConfigurationException - if there are problems creating the FilterStep from the XSLT stylesheet. Possible problems include: reading the File, parsing the File, compiling the XSLT.

      • newFilterStep

        public FilterStep newFilterStep(java.net.URL filter,
                                java.lang.String name)
                         throws FilterConfigurationException

        Creates a new FilterStep Object from a URL referencing an XSLT stylesheet.

        Parameters:
        filter - a URL Object pointing to an XSLT stylesheet
        name - the name to assign to the FilterStep
        Returns:
        a FilterStep containing a runnable version of the XSLT stylesheet
        Throws:
        FilterConfigurationException - if there are problems creating the FilterStep from the XSLT stylesheet. Possible problems include: connecting to and reading the URL, parsing the contents of the URL, compiling the XSLT.

      • newFilterStep

        public FilterStep newFilterStep(XsltExecutable filter,
                                java.lang.String name)

        Creates a new FilterStep Object from an XsltExecutable.

        Parameters:
        filter - the XsltExecutable Object to create the FilterStep from
        name - the name to assign to the FilterStep
        Returns:
        a FilterStep containing the XsltExecutable as its underlying step implementation

      • newFilterStep

                                java.lang.String name)

        Creates a FilterStep from an instance of an XMLFilterImpl.

        Parameters:

        name - the name to assign to the FilterStep
        Returns:
        a FilterStep containing an instance of the XMLFilterImpl

      • newFilterStepFromResource

        public FilterStep newFilterStepFromResource(java.lang.String resource,
                                            java.lang.String name)
                                     throws FilterConfigurationException

        Creates a FilterStep from a resource on the classpath.

        It must be possible to compile the resource as an XSLT stylesheet.

        Parameters:
        resource - a String representing the path of the resource
        name - the name to assign to the FilterStep
        Returns:
        a FilterStep containing an underlying compiled XSLT stylesheet representation of the resource
        Throws:
        FilterConfigurationException - if the resource could not be found, loaded or compiled as an XSLT stylesheet
